channel.title: Locking Spam or Worthless Topics (In this Section) and Flaming
channel.description:
So I was thinking... is there really a point to locking or deleting useless topics? Does a post count REALLY matter on this forum? Clearly it does, or else those useless topics would stay alive. The only logical reason to delete a useless topic is to prevent actual discussion ones from being visible, but if they were worth talking about and still active they wouldn't be on the brink of page 2 in the first place.
I think the only reason "No Spam or Flame" are the first rules on every forum is because EVERY other forum has it, so owners would think it's a necessity. Was Davidi2's dog dieing topic really worth locking, you terrible mod Silabsoft? (Oh no I broke a rule and directly attacked another member! If this was the real world, I wouldn't get locked up for expressing my opinion in public. I and a ton of other people get flamed all the time and nobody does crap) What harm could it possibly cause to keep it open and let others post their opinions, or just troll? If he really cared about being trolled or made fun of, he wouldn't have posted it in the first place. Whether or not a user wants something to be discussed should be up to them and not those "in control".
If the point of deleting these topics is to keep the forum civilized and an actual place for discussion, well then we're heading in the wrong direction. No matter what, people are going to flame. If you want to stop topics that create flame wars, then you're going to have to get rid of every member potential of creating one.
Obviously nobody has thought of the spam and flaming rule thoroughly, but just felt like creating one more rule because they can. If they did, they would see how pointless it is and that it truly shows that post count matters, forum space is vital, and everybody should take flaming seriously. Remember, this is the internet, and flaming doesn't actually matter. Eventually everyone will see that people like abraham2119 can only seek fun in a manner that involves mentally damaging another, and their ignorance will drive them away.
Before I go on and on and on, I want to bring up one more point. General discussion is spam overall. It doesn't help production or serve a point, so why do we have this board? Why are we only limited to discussing what those with authority think is worth discussing? This forum makes me sick. A lot of things haven't been thought through, and those smart enough to bring these things up are ignored and the awfulness of this community continues.
~Lin

Obviously nobody has thought of the spam and flaming rule thoroughly, but just felt like creating one more rule because they can. If they did, they would see how pointless it is and that it truly shows that post count matters, forum space is vital, and everybody should take flaming seriously. Remember, this is the internet, and flaming doesn’t actually matter. Eventually everyone will see that people like abraham2119 can only seek fun in a manner that involves mentally damaging another, and their ignorance will drive them away.

Before I go on and on and on, I want to bring up one more point. General discussion is spam overall. It doesn’t help production or serve a point, so why do we have this board? Why are we only limited to discussing what those with authority think is worth discussing? This forum makes me sick. A lot of things haven’t been thought through, and those smart enough to bring these things up are ignored and the awfulness of this community continues.
